title: holy shizzle (warning: perverse)
content:
This is just too mortifying not to share, as they say, "like something out of a horror story"?

http://www.thesun.co.uk/article/0,,2-2004092008,00.html [click at your own risk]

Is it real? Sounds too gruesome to be true, doesn't it.

title: Re: holy shizzle (warning: perverse)
content:
This case is quite interesting. A loner who had a kingdom of dangerous animals, snakes and lizards roaming free... Very bad luck -- if it indeed was an accident that the heating elements exploded on TWO tanks, letting the spiders and termites escape. It could be a quirky suicide for all I can see.

Also, probably a bit scary for the ones living in that building, aside the horrible death that happened, some creatures could've escaped and hidden somewhere in the building.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: holy shizzle (warning: perverse)
content:
Good for him.

I can't feel any pity for someone who treats his animals like that.-----------------

title: Re: holy shizzle (warning: perverse)
content:
People like this disgust me. You want to keep and live with so many insects and dangerous animals, go work in a zoo.____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
